, the absolute PLQY of the NCs
approached both 0 and 1. This result should be due to
lattice distortion induced by the diﬀerence between the ionic
. The PLQY decreased with the formation of
lattice defects that caused nonradiative recombination; there-
fore, relaxation of the distorted lattice would enhance the
PLQY. Inﬂuence of defects on PLQY is generally discussed by
PL decay curves. However, average PL lifetimes of the
NCs calculated from the PL decay curves
increased from 4.6 to 43.9 ns with increasing
there is a large diﬀerence in PL lifetimes of CsPbBr
NCs. The behavior of PLQY in
could not be related to the PL lifetimes.
To improve the lattice distortion of ABX
cubic perovskite structure, substitution of the A-site or B-site
cations with other cations of diﬀerent sizes is eﬀective.

method and investigated the relationship between the halide
